title: Looking back on Ebrahim Raisi, a docile Iranian president who was loyal to the supreme leader
summary: The 63-year-old ultraconservative cleric, who died in a helicopter crash on Sunday, was elected president of the Islamic Republic in 2021 after a failed bid in 2017.

title: ICC prosecutor seeks arrest warrants for Netanyahu and Hamas leaders
summary: The chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court said he believes Benjamin Netanyahu, his defense minister Yoav Gallant, and three Hamas leaders – Yehia Sinwar, Mohammed Deif and Ismail Haniyeh – are responsible for war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Gaza Strip and Israel.

title: Julian Assange can appeal against extradition to US, London court rules
summary: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange won a bid to appeal against a UK court ruling approving his extradition to the United States to face trial on espionage charges.

title: Michael Cohen says he stole from Trump's company during hush money trial
summary: Donald Trump's trial on charges of covering up hush money payments to a porn star approached its final stages with the defense finishing cross-examination of star witness Michael Cohen and closing arguments expected next week.

title: UK inquiry slams successive governments over blood scandal that killed thousands
summary: Tens of thousands of people were exposed to HIV-tainted blood after being given a new treatment in the 1970s to early 1990s. The chair of the inquiry said 'successive governments... did not put patient safety first.'

title: New Caledonia: 'The Kanak standard of living remains lower on average than that of other communities'
summary: Researcher Pierre-Yves Le Meur highlights the importance of the nickel mining industry to the archipelago's economy, and its socio-economic consequences.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: 1 million football tickets still available
summary: Tickets for the men's and women's Olympic football tournaments are struggling to sell. Of the 2.5 million tickets, 1 million have yet to be snapped up.

title: Iran's nuclear negotiator Ali Bagheri named acting foreign minister
summary: Nuclear negotiator Ali Bagheri has been named acting foreign minister of Iran after his predecessor was killed in a helicopter crash along with the president.

title: Who is Iran's first vice president, Mohammad Mokhber, appointed acting president after crash?
summary: Mokhber, 68, largely has been in the shadows compared to other politicians in Iran's Shiite theocracy. He is expected to serve as caretaker president for some 50 days before mandatory presidential elections.

title: Spain's Vox party hosts global far right ahead of EU elections
summary: Marine Le Pen, Viktor Orban, Giorgia Meloni, Javier Milei and even pro-Trump Americans took up the Spanish nationalist party's invitation to prepare 'a global alliance between patriots' at the Viva 24 conference in Madrid on Sunday.

title: Jean-Claude Gaudin, longtime mayor of Marseille, has died
summary: The politician, who died on May 20 at the age of 84, was elected to lead the city of Marseille without interruption from 1995 to 2020.

title: At the Opéra Bastille, the madness of a dreamy 'Don Quixote' in love
summary: Absent from France's premier stage since 2002, Jules Massenet's opera is reborn, served by an accomplished vocal cast and Damiano Michieletto's poetic staging.

title: Mayor of New Caledonia's capital: 'We need a pause in the institutional reform and unfreezing of the electorate'
summary: Sonia Lagarde, a supporter of Emmanuel Macron since 2017, urges the French president to take time to reform of the electoral body, which sparked riots in the territory in the Pacific territory. In an interview, she calls for 'appeasement.'

title: Taiwan's Lai Ching-te inaugurated as president, urges China to stop its military intimidation
summary: The Taiwanese leader, who was sworn in on Monday as president of the democratic island, called on China to cease political and military intimidation in his inauguration speech.

title: Paris train drivers to go on strike Tuesday over Olympic Games bonuses
summary: Rail workers' unions are pressuring SNCF in negotiations over bonuses for working through the Olympic period.

title: Monaco player taping over LGBT logo 'unacceptable,' says French sports minister
summary: The French sports minister has called for sanctions against Mohamed Camara and his Monaco club after he covered a pro-LGBTQ logo on his jersey with white tape.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Netanyahu caught between war cabinet allies and far-right partners
summary: Retired general Benny Gantz threatened to leave the war cabinet if the prime minister does not chart a clear post-war course in Gaza.

title: South Africa's top court rules former president Zuma cannot stand in election
summary: Jacob Zuma was disqualified from next week's election because he was sentenced to 15 months in prison in 2021.

title: Cannes 2024: Luxury houses are on the rise in film financing
summary: This year, three films in the official competition, including Jacques Audiard's new feature, are co-produced by Saint Laurent Productions.

title: Is that 'Her'? OpenAI pauses ChatGPT project after Scarlett Johansson issues statement over similarity to her voice
summary: Johansson said she was 'shocked, angered and in disbelief' at how similar ChatGPT's 'Sky' voice sounded to her own.
